rep.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: someone who speaks officially for a company, organization, or group of people
rep.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Safety reps have the right to stop the job when workers are in danger.
You need to speak to the students’ rep.
rep.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: repertory, or a repertory theatre or company
rep.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: Most actors start off in rep.
rep.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: one exercise that you do in a series of exercises
rep.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: the written abbreviation of Representative, used before names
rep.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: someone employed to sell a company’s products or services by meeting customers or talking to them on the phone
rep.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: We needed more sales reps on the road to compete with the big boys.
rep.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: someone who speaks officially for a group of people, company etc
rep.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: He’d had a chat with his union rep and was told not to worry.
